conversation.content: I need to speak with someone about my payment processor holding twenty thousand dollars for two weeks without notice.

I understand the severity of this situation and I sincerely apologize for the inconvenience. Let me pull up your merchant account immediately. May I have your merchant ID number or the business name registered with us?
It's Riverside Boutique. The merchant ID is RB-4521.
Thank you. I have your account here, merchant ID RB-4521-MERCH-US, and I can see the hold was placed on October 12th for exactly $20,847.36. Let me review the specifics of why this occurred.
This has seriously impacted my ability to pay suppliers and make payroll.

I completely understand the critical nature of cash flow for your business operations. The hold was triggered by our automated risk management system due to a 340% increase in transaction volume compared to your typical weekly processing of $4,200.
We had a promotional event. Surely someone could have called before freezing everything.

You're absolutely right, and I apologize that our communication failed you. According to your file, notification attempts were sent to the email address admin@riverside-boutique-2019.com, but I see those messages bounced back as undeliverable.
That email was decommissioned months ago. We updated our contact information in August.

I see the issue now. Your contact update from August 15th was processed for your customer notifications but wasn't properly synced to our risk management department's database, reference ticket UPD-8915-CONTACT-X7.
So this entire situation could have been avoided with proper internal communication?
Certainly.
When can these funds be released?

I'm escalating this immediately to our senior review team with priority code PRI-RELEASE-7K9M2. Given the documentation error on our end, I can authorize an expedited release within 2 to 4 business hours instead of the standard 48-hour review period.
That's helpful, but what about the damage this has already caused?

I understand your concern. I'm authorized to waive your processing fees for the next three months, valued at approximately $1,247.50, and I'll ensure your account receives our premium merchant support tier at no additional cost.
Will this type of hold happen again if we run another promotion?

To prevent future occurrences, I'm adding a verified promotion flag to your account with authorization code PROMO-VERIFIED-2024-Q4, which pre-approves transaction increases up to 500% of your baseline for planned events you register 48 hours in advance.
I need written confirmation of everything we've discussed today, including the release timeline.

Of course. I'm sending a detailed summary to your corrected email address right now with case number CS-20241028-RB4521-PRIORITY. You'll also receive direct contact information for myself and my supervisor, along with our executive escalation line at 888-542-7700 extension 4019.
